title: Election campaigns to end at midnight today: Elections Commission
byline: The Elections Commission announced that all campaign activities related to the parliamentary elections will conclude at midnight today.

title: At least 40 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza, medics say
byline: At least 40 Palestinians were killed by Israeli strikes across Gaza on Sunday, including two dozen when a residential building in the northern town of Jabalia was hit, Palestinian health officials and a human rights group said.

title: If Ranil was President 3rd IMF installment will have been received by now: Manusha
byline: If Ranil Wickremesinghe had remained as President, then the third loan installment of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) would have been received by now, former Minister Manusha Nanayakara said.

title: Bad weather suspends ferry service, full refund issued: IndSri Ferry Service
byline: A full refund has been issued to passengers who reserved tickets for the ferry service between Nagapattinam in India and Kankesanthurai (KKS) due to the suspension of service from last Thursday (7) due to bad weather.

title: October remittances at US$ 588mn provide strong bulwark for economy
byline: Worker remittances for October continued to come in stronger against both a month ago as well as a year ago period helping both the foreign currency reserves and the rupee to remain strong.

title: Tourism leaders urge singular approach to double Sri Lanka’s visitor numbers
byline: As Sri Lanka stands on the cusp of a potential tourism boom, industry leaders are calling for a unified approach to drive demand for the destination while preserving its unique, authentic edge over competing markets.

title: Sri Lanka Police empowered to implement law without influence: Acting IGP
byline: Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya said the Sri Lanka Police now operates in an environment conducive to enforcing the law impartially and without undue influence.

title: Sujeewa hands over vehicle to court
byline: Samagi Jana Sandanaya (SJS) National Organiser Sujeewa Senasinghe said he has handed over his vehicle to the Supreme Court for further investigations.

title: Total of 2,000 cyberbullying incidents reported so far this year
byline: A total of 2,000 incidents of cyberbullying have been reported so far this year, according to the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT).

title: Polling cards now available online
byline: Ahead of the Parliamentary elections, the Election Commission has launched an online system enabling voters to access their polling cards.

title: Rohitha becomes emotional at election rally
byline: Former MP Rohitha Abeygunawardhane became emotional during an election rally in Kalutara where he said, with tears in his eyes, that he had been with the people over the years.

title: Trump, Putin speak as Biden plans to lobby Trump to stick with Ukraine
byline: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin and advised him not to escalate the Ukraine war, a source familiar with the conversation told Reuters on Sunday, as President Joe Biden plans to urge Trump not to abandon Kyiv.

title: Ishiba formally reelected as Japan PM, eyes minority gov’t
byline: Shigeru Ishiba was formally reelected as Japan’s prime minister on Monday after a rare runoff vote in parliament that his ruling coalition no longer controls, setting the stage for a minority government that may push him to yield more to an emboldened opposition bloc.

title: Thundershowers possible in most parts of island from Nov 13
byline: A low-pressure area is likely to develop over the south west Bay of Bengal during the next 24 hours, the Meteorological Department said.

title: Moscow targeted as Ukraine and Russia trade huge drone attacks
byline: Russia and Ukraine have carried out their largest drone attacks against each other since the start of the war.

title: People bussed from different districts for the president’s rally in North: Sumanthiran
byline: Former TNA MP M.A. Sumanthiran alleged that President Anura Kumara Dissanayake had brought several thousands of people in buses last evening all the way to Jaffna to participate in the NPP’s political rally attended by the President.

title: Price of an egg will increase to Rs 1000 if SL fails to stabilize economy: RW
byline: Price of an egg will rise to Rs 1000 if Sri Lanka fails to stabilize the economy, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: All universities to remain closed on Nov. 13, 14
byline: All universities in the country will be closed on November 13 and 14 in view of the 2024 General Elections, the University Grants Commission (UGC) announced.

title: All liquor shops islandwide to close on Nov. 14, 15
byline: The Commissioner General of Excise announced that all liquor shops and wine stores across the island will be closed on November 14 and 15 due to the upcoming general elections.

title: Thomians crowned champs
byline: S. Thomas’ College stamped their class by winning the Cup Championship of the All-Island Under-14 Elite Ten-a-Side Rugby Tournament 2024, defeating Science College 12-5 in the Cup final at the Sugathadasa Stadium.

title: Polling cards available online: EC
byline: Ahead of the Parliamentary election scheduled for November 14, the Election Commission has launched an online system enabling voters to access their polling cards.

title: MR appoints Cassilingham as Jaffna District Organizer of SLPP
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Politbureau Member Geethanath Cassilingham has been appointed as the Jaffna District Organizer of the party, by its leader Mahinda Rajapaksa this evening.

title: Train service between Colombo-Talaimannar to resume tomorrow
byline: Train services on the Talaimannar railway line will resume tomorrow, Deputy General Manager of Railways (Transportation) M.J. Indipolage said.

title: JVP has forgotten November Heroes’ commemoration: Kumar Gunaratnam
byline: Frontline Socialist Party (FSP), a breakaway group of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP), today said the latter which is governing the country today had even neglected the commemoration of November heroes on the due date.

title: India will not travel to Champions Trophy - PCB
byline: India has informed the International Cricket Council it will not travel to the Champions Trophy, according to hosts Pakistan.

title: 976 solar pannel systems installed on rooftops of religious shrines: Energy Ministry
byline: A total of 976 solar panel systems have been installed on the rooftops of religious shrines across the country with financial support from the Government of India, the Ministry of Energy said.

title: Sujeewa hands over vehicle to court
byline: Samagi Jana Sandanaya (SJS) National Organiser Sujeewa Senasinghe said he has handed over his vehicle to the Supreme Court for further investigations.

title: Total of 2,000 cyberbullying incidents reported so far this year
byline: A total of 2,000 incidents of cyberbullying have been reported so far this year, according to the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT).

title: Polling cards now available online
byline: Ahead of the Parliamentary elections, the Election Commission has launched an online system enabling voters to access their polling cards.

title: Rohitha becomes emotional at election rally
byline: Former MP Rohitha Abeygunawardhane became emotional during an election rally in Kalutara where he said, with tears in his eyes, that he had been with the people over the years.

title: Ishiba formally reelected as Japan PM, eyes minority gov’t
byline: Shigeru Ishiba was formally reelected as Japan’s prime minister on Monday after a rare runoff vote in parliament that his ruling coalition no longer controls, setting the stage for a minority government that may push him to yield more to an emboldened opposition bloc.

title: Trump, Putin speak as Biden plans to lobby Trump to stick with Ukraine
byline: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin and advised him not to escalate the Ukraine war, a source familiar with the conversation told Reuters on Sunday, as President Joe Biden plans to urge Trump not to abandon Kyiv.

title: Thundershowers possible in most parts of island from Nov 13
byline: A low-pressure area is likely to develop over the south west Bay of Bengal during the next 24 hours, the Meteorological Department said.

title: Moscow targeted as Ukraine and Russia trade huge drone attacks
byline: Russia and Ukraine have carried out their largest drone attacks against each other since the start of the war.

byline: Former TNA MP M.A. Sumanthiran alleged that President Anura Kumara Dissanayake had brought several thousands of people in buses last evening all the way to Jaffna to participate in the NPP’s political rally attended by the President.

byline: Price of an egg will rise to Rs 1000 if Sri Lanka fails to stabilize the economy, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said yesterday.

title: All universities to remain closed on Nov. 13, 14
byline: All universities in the country will be closed on November 13 and 14 in view of the 2024 General Elections, the University Grants Commission (UGC) announced.

title: All liquor shops islandwide to close on Nov. 14, 15
byline: The Commissioner General of Excise announced that all liquor shops and wine stores across the island will be closed on November 14 and 15 due to the upcoming general elections.

title: Thomians crowned champs
byline: S. Thomas’ College stamped their class by winning the Cup Championship of the All-Island Under-14 Elite Ten-a-Side Rugby Tournament 2024, defeating Science College 12-5 in the Cup final at the Sugathadasa Stadium.
